organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Grannies Against the Right (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 5 October 2023, 220 people, including Grannies against the Right, participated in a protest called for by a broad alliance of SPD, CDU, the Greens, the Left, FDP, Jusos, the JL as well as the associations 'Willkommen in Ronnenberg (WiR)' (Welcome in Ronnenberg), 'Erinnerungsarbeit Ronnenberg' (Remembrance Work Ronnenberg) and 'Weetzen ist Rege (WIR)' (Weetzen is Rege), in Ronnenberg (Region Hannover, Niedersachsen) against racism and right-wing populism and for democracy. The protest occurred in the context of the Autumn Fest of the AfD in Ronnenberg.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 4 October 2023, about 1,000 people, including employees of Bosch Rexroth, ZF Friedrichshafen and Siemens, as well as Bad Neustadt's mayor Michael Werner (FW) and District Administrator Thomas Habermann (CSU), protested in Bad Neustadt an der Saale (Rhon-Grabfeld, Bayern) against the partial closure of the automotive supplier Valio.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; EU: European Union; Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany); Labor Group (Belgium); Labor Group (Germany); Protesters (Belgium)
description: On 3 October 2023, at the call of NGG (Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gaststatten), numerous people from Issum, including the mayor (independent), MPs (CDU), trade unionists, the Deputy Secretary General at European Federation of Food, Agriculture and Tourism Unions, and employees of Diebels from all over Germany and Belgium, protested in Issum against job cuts.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 3 October 2023, at least 5,000 people, including members of 'Teterow fur Deutschland', 'Oberhavel steht auf' (Oberhavel stands up), AfD members and MPs, demonstrated in the Lustgarten in Berlin - Mitte to call for the resignation of the government, politician liability, and more referendums. People from the anti-coronavirus-related measures scene also participated. Demonstrators denounced energy prices amid inflation and called for more borders control against immigration. Around 50 members of Grannies Against the Right gathered for a counter-protest.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 3 October 2023, at the call of FDP, The Greens, and SPD, several hundred people, including members of JULIA - Jungliberale Aktion (Young Liberal Action) the youth association of the FDP, demonstrated in Dresden against an ongoing event of the far-right political party AFD. Protesters were against far-right extremism and racism. They gathered on the occasion of German Unity Day.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Free Saxony; Querdenken
description: On 3 October 2023, around 1,300 people, including AFD, Free Saxony, and Querdenken affiliates, gathered at Hofwiesenpark and demonstrated in Gera to call for the resignation of the Prime Minister, and the federal government. They called for more border controls and deportation. Around 600 people, including Antifa, Gera gegen Rechts (Gera Against the Right), and 'Wir sind die Brandmauer', gathered for a counter-protest in 3 different locations.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 3 October 2023, at the call of 'Nazifrei', a cross-party association, around 250 people, including the mayor (The Greens), demonstrated in Goppingen against extremism, anti-constitutionalism and populism. They gathered to denounce the hostile behavior of AfD affiliates at a city festival towards the stalls of other political parties, notably The Greens.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria
description: On 3 October 2023, at the call of CDU, CSU, and Modlareuth Grenzenlos Bunt, people gathered not far from the German Museum Modlareuth in Topen against an election campaign event of the far-right political party AFD. They were against far-right extremism. Protesters wanted to stand for democracy and cosmopolitanism. In total (with the rally and the protest), between 5,000 and 6,000 people gathered there on the occasion German Unity Day.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 2 October 2023, at the call of an AFD local councilor, around 60 people demonstrated in front of the town hall in Hechingen against welcoming refugees. They carried banners with the message 'Our country first'. According to the report, they have met every week - for many months as a 'Monday demonstration'.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Independent Politicians (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 30 September 2023, numerous people, including the Minister President of Lower Saxony (SPD), the mayor (independent), DGB, Christians, and Grannies Against the Right, demonstrated in Eschede against a festival of far-right affiliates on a farm belonging to the Heimat (previously NPD) members and neo-Nazis.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 27 September 2023, people, including the mayor (The Greens), an MP (SPD), members of welfare associations, and trade unions, demonstrated in the Barmen district in Wuppertal against the government's austerity plan and cuts in the social sector.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 26 September 2023, a good 100 people, including members of the SPD, and of the electoral groups 'UWG: Freie Burger' (a independent voters' association at the level of local politics) and 'LGU: Landwirtschaft, Gartenbau, Umwelt' (Agriculture, Horticulture, Environment), joined a protest in Beetz in Kremmen (Oberhavel, Brandenburg) called for by the 'Initiative gegen Windraeder im Beetzer Wald' (Initiative against wind wheels in the Beetz forest) against the planned construction of 7 wind wheels due to concerns regarding amongst others soil sealing and water storage.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 25 September 2023, around 40 people, including Weissenfels' mayor Martin Papke of the CDU, participated in a protest in Weissenfels (Burgenlandkreis, Sachsen-Anhalt) organized by 'Stadt.Raum.Initiative' (City.Space.Initiative) against high prices, educational shortages and other crises.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; OEDP: Ecological Democratic Party; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 24 September 2023, around 400 people from Groshadern, Pasing and Wurmtal, including members of the Greens, OEDP, the Left, CSU, BUND as well as Grunzug-Netzwerk Wurmtal, protested at Lochhamer Schlag in Grafelfing (Munchen, Bayern) against the planned gravel mining in the area, and calling for forest preservation.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 23 September 2023, people, including members of the AfD, Mittelstandsinitiative Brandenburg and Freie Brandenburger, participated in a conspiracy ideological protest in Cottbus (Brandenburg).

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Syrian Group (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 23 September 2023, people, including women, members of the Syrian community, representatives of the Left and members of Grannies Against the Right, protested in Verden (Niedersachsen) to draw attention to acts of violence against women and call for an end to femicides. The protest occurred after 31-year-old Syrian Suha A. was killed by her partner with sixteen stab wounds on September 9, 2023.

organizers: The Left (Germany)
description: On 23 September 2023, around 200 people, including representatives of the Left, protested on Friedrichsplatz in Kassel (Hessen) against the appearance of AfD deputy Stephan Brandner for a election campaign event. Some of the protesters tried breaking through the police, with some minor scuffles and pushes occurring.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Marburger Bund; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 20 September 2023, around 1,000 employees of Rhineland-Palatinate hospitals, including nursing staff, doctors, midwives, trainees, technicians, and administrative staff, supported by representatives of the CDU and the Rhineland-Palatinate Hospital Federation, participated in a protest in Mainz (Rheinland-Pfalz) called for by an alliance including the hospital association, the state medical association, the state nursing association, the municipal employers' association and the Ver.di trade union, the Marburger Bund, the state association of senior hospital physicians and the state association of midwives. The protest was under the motto 'Alarmstufe Rot - Krankenhauser in Not' (Red Alert - Hospitals in Need) and the participants demanded more funding for hospitals from the federal government, permanent inflation compensation, and full financing of the agreed 10 percent tariff increases in 2024. The protest was part of a nationwide protest day under the motto 'Stoppt das Krankenhaussterben' called for by the German Hospital Federation and supported by Ver.di.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FW: Free Voters; Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Marburger Bund; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 20 September 2023, around 5,000 employees of Baden Wurttemberg hospitals, including nursing staff, doctors, trainees, technicians, and administrative staff, supported by representatives of the CDU, SPD, the Greens, the Marburger Bund, the FW, the state senior council and Ver.di, participated in a protest in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) called for by the 'Baden-Wurttembergische Krankenhausgesellschaft' (Hospital Federation of Baden-Wurttemberg) (BWKG) under the motto 'Alarmstufe Rot - Krankenhauser in Not' (Red Alert - Hospitals in Need). They demanded more funding for hospitals from the federal government, permanent inflation compensation, and full financing of the agreed 10 percent tariff increases in 2024. The protest was part of a nationwide protest day under the motto 'Stoppt das Krankenhaussterben' called for by the German Hospital Federation.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 20 September 2023, around 6,000 to 10,000 employees of North Rhine-Westphalia hospitals, including nursing staff, doctors, trainees, technicians, and administrative staff, supported by representatives of the CDU, SPD and Ver.di, participated in a protest called for by the 'Krankenhausgesellschaft Nordrhein-Westfalen' (Hospital Federation of North Rhine-Westphalia) (KGNW) in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to demand more funding for hospitals from the federal government. They called for permanent inflation compensation and full financing of the agreed 10 percent tariff increases in 2024. The protest was part of a nationwide protest day under the motto 'Stoppt das Krankenhaussterben' called for by the German Hospital Federation.

organizers: Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 20 September 2023, around 2,500 employees of Lower Saxony hospitals, including nursing staff, doctors, midwives, trainees, technicians, and administrative staff, supported by representatives of the SPD and the Lower Saxony Hospital Federation, participated in a protest in Hannover (Region Hannover, Niedersachsen) to demand more funding for hospitals from the federal government, permanent inflation compensation, and full financing of the agreed 10 percent tariff increases in 2024. The protest was part of a nationwide protest day under the motto 'Stoppt das Krankenhaussterben' called for by the German Hospital Federation and supported by Ver.di.

organizers: Antifa; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 17 September 2023, people, including Jusos, Antifa and the Greens, protested in Muhldorf am Inn (Muhldorf a.Inn, Bayern) against an AfD rally.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 16 September 2023, around 150 people, including an MP (SPD), demonstrated in Schwerin against xenophobia and queerphobia. They gathered for solidarity, tolerance and cosmopolitanism.

organizers: MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 16 September 2023, around 2,500 people demonstrated in Hamburg against the Iranian government. They gathered on the occasion of the first anniversary of the death of Jina Mahsa Amini. Members of the MLPD participated in two protests, one of them with about 250 participants.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Iranian Group (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Protesters (Iran); Refugees/IDPs (Iran); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 16 September 2023, at the call of FemPower, around 350 people, including Iranian community members, Iranian refugees, unions, MPs (SPD, CDU), Lower Saxony's Deputy Prime Minister (The Greens), gathered at Opernplatz in Hannover to protest against the Iranian government. Demonstrators called on Iranian authorities to respect human rights. They gathered on the occasion of the first anniversary of the death of Jina Mahsa Amini.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Independent Politicians (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 16 September 2023, at the call of the Alliance for Democracy and Diversity, between 350 (according to the police) and 500 people, including the mayor (independent), Camp-Zang members, an MP (SPD), The Greens members, and Grannies Against the Right, demonstrated from the town hall across Hamburger Strasse, through Lindenstrasse and Kirchweg past the industrial area in Henstedt-Ulzburg against far-right extremism, fascism, Nazis, and the AFD. Although the vast majority of participants protested peacefully, the police officers used tear gas against several people who tried to break through a barrier. The paint of a patrol car was slightly scratched because of a barrier fell and one person tried to hit an officer but only touched them lightly without injuring anyone.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; BPD: The Grassroots Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 16 September 2023, around 2,000 people, including members of far-right parties (AFD, BPD), gathered at the Cathedral square and demonstrated in Magdeburg for more democracy under the motto 'Germany stands up!'. They protested against the federal government. Demonstrators gathered on the occasion of the Day of Truth and called themselves the 'red line'. They were against coronavirus-related measures. At the call of Solidarity Magdeburg and the Left Youth Solid, around 140 people gathered for a counter-protest under the motto 'We're taking a seat'. They were against far-right ideologies and conspiracy narratives.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 15 September 2023, around 70 people, including members of Christians for Future and a district councilor (The Greens), demonstrated in Miesbach for climate protection. The event was part of a 13th Global Climate Strike called by the FFF to demand the implementation of promised funds ('climate money') to tackle rising carbon and energy prices on citizens, more laws to reduce climate-damaging emissions by 65% by 2030, a quick exit from fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas), and a mobility shift.

organizers: ADFC: German Bicycle Club; FFF: Fridays for Future; NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 15 September 2023, around 100 people, including members of Parents for Future, NABU, ADFC, Terres des Hommes, The Greens, and 'Our Oberberg is colorful, not brown', demonstrated via Dr.-Meinerzhagen-Street, Kolner Street. Haupt Street and Pfarrgasse, back to the market square in Lindlar for climate protection. The event was part of a 13th Global Climate Strike called by the FFF to demand the implementation of promised funds ('climate money') to tackle rising carbon and energy prices on citizens, more laws to reduce climate-damaging emissions by 65% by 2030, a quick exit from fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas), and a mobility shift.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; FFF: Fridays for Future; Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 14 September 2023, around 100 people, including members of Grannies Against the Right, The Greens, and BUND, demonstrated in Aalen for climate protection. The event was part of a 13th Global Climate Strike called by the FFF to demand the implementation of promised funds ('climate money') to tackle rising carbon and energy prices on citizens, more laws to reduce climate-damaging emissions by 65% by 2030, a quick exit from fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas), and a mobility shift.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 13 September 2023, at the call of the AFD, people demonstrated at the market square in Luckenwalde against immigration. They called on the government to stop welcoming migrants. One intoxicated demonstrator resisted police instructions, insulted an officer, and attempted to physically assault the officers. He was temporarily arrested and slightly injured. At the call of 'Colorful Luckenwalde', people, including members of Jusos, The Green Youth, Left Youth Solid, and 'Democratic Alliance Teltow-Flaming' members, gathered for a counter-demonstration against AFD and for human rights. They wanted to spread messages of peaceful coexistence and tolerance regarding immigration matters.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 September 2023, at the call of a councilor (The Greens), around 150 people gathered at Marienplatz in Weilheim in Oberbayern against the far-right political party AfD which was holding an event at the same time.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 12 September 2023, 300 people, including representatives of the Greens and the SPD, protested opposite the sports center in Uberacker (Furstenfeldbruck, Bayern) as a counter-event to an AfD state election campaign event and the participation of Beatrix von Storch, a prominent federal politician from the AfD.

organizers: IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 12 September 2023, people, mostly striking employees of AOC Jena Optical, members of IGM, and MLPD, demonstrated in Jena against the possible closure of the company.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 11 September 2023, 90 people participated in a Monday demonstration in Eisenhuttenstadt (Oder-Spree, Brandenburg), organized by the city councilor for the AfD, for freedom, self-determination, and peace.

organizers: Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 10 September 2023, around 800 people, including representatives of the protestant church, the Left and Ver.di, protested on Schlossplatz in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) against military aid for Ukraine. A few hundred meters away, in the Obere Schlossgarten, the 'Team-Ukraine Demo in Stuttgart' held a counter-protest with about 200 people, including many Ukrainian refugee women and children, under the motto 'Die Ukraine ist unteilbar' (Ukraine is indivisible) for more support for their compatriots in the war against the Russian occupier.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 10 September 2023, around 350 people, including AfD-politicians, participated in a protest organized by the movement 'Bernburg bleibt stark' (Bernburg stays strong) on Karlsplatz in Bernburg (Saale) (Salzlandkreis, Sachsen-Anhalt) to demonstrate for peace and against current politics. Students and unions held a counter-protest under the motto 'Bernburg bleibt bunt' (Bernburg remains colorful) was held in the Talstadt in Bernburg.

organizers: JL: Young Liberals; LGBTQ+ (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 10 September 2023, around 80 people, including representatives of the Left, the Greens and the JL, participated in the Christopher Street Day in Bad Hersfeld (Hersfeld-Rotenburg, Hessen) to protest against homophobia, for tolerance, and the rights of LGBTQ+.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; Labor Group (Germany); The Left (Germany); VCD: Traffic Club Germany
description: On 10 September 2023, more than 3,000 people, including members of the alliances 'No Future for IAA', 'Sand im Getriebe', 'Smash IAA' as well as trade unionists, Marxists and the Left, protested in Munchen (Bayern) under the motto '#blockIAA' against the International Motor Show Germany (IAA). At Karolienplatz, 380 cyclists participating in a protest organized by the VCD Munich, BUND, Natur-Freunde (Nature-Friends) and supported by Munchner Initiative Nachhaltigkeit (Munich Sustainability Initiative) join the demonstration.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 9 September 2023, 1,500 people participated in a counter protest on Aachener Markt in Aachen (Stadteregion Aachen, Nordrhein-Westfalen) against a demonstration of almost 150 AfD supporters. Reasons behind the AfD protest were not reported.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 9 September 2023, around 70 people, including members of AfD, protested in Upahl (Nordwestmecklenburg; Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) against the refugee policy and the construction of a refugee container accommodation. On the edge of the demonstration verbal arguments between participants and a group of journalists, accused by protesters of being members of the far-left.

organizers: The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 8 September 2023, 84 people, including members of the Left and the Greens, participated in a demonstration, organized by the Aktionsbundnis Grevesmuhlen, under the motto 'Wir sind bunt, was seid ihr?' (We are colorful, what are you?) in Grevesmuhlen (Nordwestmecklenburg, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) to protest for more diversity and tolerance.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 7 September 2023, hundreds of people, or about 1,200 people participated in a protest, on the call of the mayor, the SPD-City council leader, and the Democracy Forum Oranienburg and supported by trade union associations, in Oranienburg (Oberhavel, Brandenburg) against the AfD which simultaneously held an event for the upcoming state election campaign.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 6 September 2023, around 30 people, including SPD members, held a protest across the restaurant 'Zum Weissen Ross' in Bad Breisig (Ahrweiler, Rheinland-Pfalz) against the AfD district association's citizens' dialogue, which was holding a meeting at the restaurant, and to send a clear signal for diversity.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 5 September 2023, at the call of Ver.di, around 500 people, mostly striking retail employees and the mayor (SPD), gathered on the market square and demonstrated in Bremen to call for better pay in retail, wholesale, and foreign trade.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: Around 4 September 2023 (as reported), at the call of Grannies Against the Right, around 120 people, including members of SPD, The Left, and The Greens, demonstrated in front of the Lowen Hall in Lindenberg im Allgau (Lindau (Bodensee), Bayern) against an ongoing rally of the far-right political party AfD. They denounced the party's racism, sexism, and neoliberalism.

organizers: ADFC: German Bicycle Club; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 3 September 2023, at the call of ADFC, around 500 cyclists, including mayors (CDU, SPD), demonstrated from Balve with a stop on the Menden market square to the Frondenberg town hall to call for a cycle path that safely connects the cities.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 2 September 2023, around 200 people, including an SPD state parliament candidate, staged a protest on land and water from Trebelsee to the Havel promenade in Ketzin to demand legal clarification of the navigability of the waters.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 2 September 2023, around 4,000 people, including an MP (The Left), demonstrated in Erfurt for LGBTQ+ rights at a Christopher Street Day (CSD) protest. Protesters called on the government to fund projects against discrimination that promote acceptance and diversity.

organizers: Antifa; Attac; DFG-VK: The German Peace Community; Government of Germany (2021-); IL: Interventionist Left; The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 2 September 2023, at the call of the Berlin Anti-War Coordination, around 700 people, including members of The Left, an MP (The Left), the Rheinmetall Disarm Initiative, the Information Center for Militarization, the International of War Resisters, Revolutionary Women, Lichtenberg district committee, the Wedding community, Nordeast Antifa (NEA), the Interventionist Left, the Offensive Against Rearmament alliance, Attac, DFG-VK, and the Naturefriends, gathered on Pariser Platz and demonstrated in front of the Bundeswehr career center at Friedrichstrasse train station to Platz des 18 Marz in Berlin - Mitte against war and rearmament. Demonstrators passed by the Russian embassy. They called for the freedom of Boris Kagarlitsky and other prisoners. Protesters also condemned the Russian attack on Ukraine and the involvement of Western forces (USA, EU, etc.) in it.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: Around 2 September 2023 (as reported), at the call of the Alliance for Tolerance and Civil Courage, over 300 people, including mayors (SPD), and MPs (CDU, SPD), demonstrated in Hilchenbach against actions of the far-right group The Third Path within the city.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 September 2023, at the call of DGB, around 70 people, including Catholics, members of The Left, the German Peace Society, and United War Resisters, demonstrated at Hafler Antoniusplatz in Friedrichshafen to call for peace, and the withdrawal from NATO. Demonstrators were against rearmament and the war in Ukraine. They denounced how wars are harmful to the climate and gathered on the occasion of Anti-War Day.

organizers: FVC: Women Association Courage; MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 1 September 2023, around 250 people, including members of MLPD and FVC, demonstrated to Westend in Munchen against fascism, the political party AFD, imperialism, and the Turkish government and its hostile policies against the Kurdish community. Demonstrators showed solidarity with Ukrainian and Russian workers and were against the war in Ukraine condemning both Western (NATO) and Russian sides. They gathered on the occasion of Anti-War Day.

organizers: DKP: German Communist Party; FVC: Women Association Courage; IB: Internationalist Alliance; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; REBELL: Youth League Rebel; Women (Germany)
description: On 1 September 2023, between 60 and 70 people, including members of FVC, MLPD, PIA - Platform of International Women Workers, KJVD - Young Communist League of Germany (linked to the German Communist Party), BirKar, IB, and REBELL, demonstrated in Essen against imperialist wars (including the one in Ukraine) whether they were led by NATO or Russia. They also were against the AFD. Demonstrators also called for a memorial to women in the resistance, and denounced the German government's anti-communist repression, as well as the anti-migrants European policies. They gathered on the occasion of Anti-War Day.

organizers: IB: Internationalist Alliance; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 1 September 2023, people, including IB, UG - Environmental Union (which includes environmental activists, union members, and scientists), and MLPD members, demonstrated from the Citypoint to Drehscheibe in Bochum against the war in Ukraine and the involvement of imperialist states. Demonstrators also denounced the environmental catastrophe. They gathered on the occasion of Anti-War Day and were also against the AFD.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 30 August 2023, at the call of the Youth Employment Assistance Service, hundreds of people, including the mayor (CDU) and DGB members, demonstrated in front of the town hall in Essen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against new austerity plans. They denounced budget cuts made at the expense of young people.

organizers: IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SI: Solidarity International
description: On 26 August 2023, people, including members of MLPD, IGM, and SI protested in front of the Federal Chancellery in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) to demand the issuance of visas for the miners and United Front Congress participants.

organizers: LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 26 August 2023, about 12,000 people, including numerous politicians belonging to the SPD and other parties, participated in Christopher Street Day in Bremen (Bremen) to protest for the rights of LGBTQ+ and against discrimination based on gender identity and sexual orientation.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party
description: On 21 August 2023, people, including members of the FDP, participated in a vigil commemorating the victims of the Russian war in Ukraine and protesting against the conflict in front of the Russian embassy in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) with a varied program with art, dance and speeches.

organizers: The Greens (Germany)
description: On 19 August 2023, around 100 people participated in the first 'Disability and Mad Pride Bonn' on Frankenbadplatz in Bonn (Nordrhein-Westfalen), partly organized by members of the Greens, to protest for the rights of disabled, chronic and mentally ill people such as neurodivergent and deaf people, as well as for more inclusion of people with disabilities and more accessibility.

organizers: MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 19 August 2023, groups of the miners' initiative 'Kumpel fur AUF', participated in a protest in Duisburg-Walsum (Duisburg, Nordrhein-Westfalen), supported by the MLPD, for a future worth living in and the preservation of human livelihoods and for the issue of visas by German embassies to 20 participants of the 3rd International Miners' Conference.

organizers: Last Generation (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: Around 17 August 2023 (as reported), at the call of Last Generation, people, including members of MLPD, demonstrated in Krefeld (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to denounce the government's responsibility concerning the climate deregulation. They also criticized the criminalization of the climate movement.

organizers: FVC: Women Association Courage; IGBCE: Industrial Union for Mining, Chemistry and Energy; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 16 August 2023, around 200 people, including members of SPD, MLPD, IGBCE, The Greens, The Left, and FVC, demonstrated in Herten against an ongoing rally of the far-right political party AFD. They yelled 'Nazis out'. Protesters were against far-right ideas and fascism.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 13 August 2023, representatives of the State Opera Foundation, the Movenpick am Kropcke, the Friends of Hanover and the SPD protested on the Kropcke in Hannover (Region Hannover, Niedersachsen) against antisemitism and to show their solidarity with of opera director Laura Berman, who was insulted anti-semitically.

organizers: LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 12 August 2023, the LesBiSchwulen park fest was organized in Volkspark Friedrichshain in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin), with stands of the SPD and the Left amongst others, to protest against discrimination of all sorts and for the rights of LGBTQ+.

organizers: FVC: Women Association Courage; IB: Internationalist Alliance; MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Protesters (International); Refugees/IDPs (International); SI: Solidarity International; The Left (Germany); Turkish Group (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 12 August 2023, several hundred people, or around 1,200, took part in a march organized by 'Solidaritatskreis Mouhamed' and about 70 in a simultaneous demonstration organized by 'Freundeskreis Mouhamed', gathering in front of the main train station in Dortmund (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against police violence and for the investigation of deadly police shots at a 16-year-old refugee a year before. The protesters included many refugees, representatives of the MLPD and the Left as well as members of the FVC, SI, IB and the Confederation of Workers from Turkey in Germany (ATIF).

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 7 August 2023, members of AFD demonstrated in Furstenwalde (Brandenburg) against refugee emergency shelters in sports halls. People, including members of Die Partei, and The Greens, gathered for a counter-protest.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; LGBTQ+ (Germany); Standup Against Racism; The Left (Germany)
description: On 5 August 2023, members of the Left Party, Jusos, 'First Aid Collective Central Saxony', and Standup Against Racism, demonstrated in Frankenberg/Sachsen (Sachsen) under the motto 'Queer through the province' for LGBTQ+ rights. They denounced police repression, anti-Semitism, racism, sexism, anti-communism, and fascism. A passer-by did the Nazi salute facing protesters.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 5 August 2023, between 200,000 and 250,000 people, including the mayor (SPD) and elected officials (The Greens), demonstrated in Hamburg for LGBTQ+ rights, a self-determined life, and against intolerance. Protesters also denounced the attacks on the LGBTQ+ community that accompanied the CSD throughout the country. They gathered on the occasion of Christopher Street Day (CSD).

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany)
description: On 5 August 2023, around 11,000 people, including the mayor (CSU), demonstrated in Nurnberg (Bayern) in support of LGBTQ+ rights. They gathered on the occasion of Christopher Street Day (CSD). Protesters demanded a more consistent prosecution and recording of anti-queer crimes.

organizers: Antifa; MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 5 August 2023, about 200 people, including members of the MLPD and Antifa, protested in Pewsum in Krummhorn (Aurich, Niedersachsen) against a fascist meeting with a concert happening at the same time and demanded a ban of all fascist organizations and their propaganda.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Querdenken
description: On 5 August 2023, at the call of the 'Democracy Movement' around 4,600 people, including Querdenken affiliates and an MP (AFD), gathered at the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) under the motto 'Peace, Freedom, Truth, Joy' to protest in favor of peace and disarmament concerning the war in Ukraine. Protesters were against coronavirus vaccination, NATO, the German government, the media, The Greens, and the United States of America. Some carried Russian flags. A Holocaust denier was present. At the call of Grannies Against the Right and Antifa, around 30 people gathered on Behrenstrasse for a counter-demonstration against the conspiracy ideological spectrum.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 5 August 2023, at the call of the Partnership for Democracy, at least 200 people, including the mayor (Independent), an MP (SPD), and the president of 'East Frisian Landscape', demonstrated in Krummhorn (Niedersachsen) against a concert starring bands they accused of being close to the far-right and neo-Nazi's scene.

organizers: AI: Amnesty International; Evangelical Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany); LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 29 July 2023, around 1,000 people participated in a pride parade starting at Adenauerplatz and ending at Schillerpark in Wiesloch (Rhein-Neckar-Kreis, Baden-Wurttemberg) to campaign for the rights of LGBTQ+ as well as refugees, people with disabilities and people with chronic illnesses. The Mayor Dirk Elkemann (Independent), Evangelical pastors, members of SPD and the Greens were among the participants.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 29 July 2023, around 2,500 people, from various federal states, belonging to the alliance 'Solidarisches Magdeburg', 'Omas gegen Rechts' and the MLPD amongst others, demonstrated in the inner city of Magdeburg against the AFD's federal party conference and to set a sign against racism, fascism and antisemitism.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Government of Ukraine (2019-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); LGBTQ+ (Namibia); LGBTQ+ (Netherlands); LGBTQ+ (Ukraine); Protesters (Namibia); Protesters (Netherlands); Protesters (Ukraine); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 22 July 2023, thousands of people, including elected officials such as the mayor (CDU) and the president of the Parliament (SPD), the Ukrainian ambassador, LGBTQ+ communities from the Netherlands, Ukraine, and Namibia, demonstrated from Potsdamer Strasse, and Leipziger Strasse, to several districts (on 7.4 kilometers) until the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin - Mitte, for LGBTQ+ rights. Protesters called for more empathy and solidarity.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Querdenken
description: On 22 July 2023, around 100 people, including members of AFD, Querdenken, climate skeptics, and anti-vaxxers, from Hamburg, Itzehoe, and Kiel, demonstrated in Bad Bramstedt against the participation of Germany in the war in Ukraine, claiming it could have consequences on the country's economy. They were also against the 'early sexualization of children'. Around 30 people, including many local politicians (The Greens) and Grannies Against the Right, gathered for a counter-protest on the market square.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 22 July 2023, around 30 people, mostly elected officials (The Greens, CDU, FDP), MPs (SPD), and citizens, demonstrated in Laatzen against far-right opinions after the far-right political party AfD set up an information stand in the Laatzen district of Rethen.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 22 July 2023, at the call of Munich Remember, around 600 people, including the mayor (SPD), gathered at the Munich Remembrance Memorial, and others marched from Moosacher Bahnhof to Hanauer Strasse in Munchen, to denounce racism. They gathered on the occasion of the commemoration of victims of the far-right attack of 2016. Relatives and survivors called on authorities to recognize the attack as far-right terrorism similar to the ones of Halle and Hanau.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 21 July 2023, people, including an MP (The Greens), demonstrated in the St Georg district in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte to denounce increasing deaths due to drug addiction. Protesters highlighted the most urgent problems that the government has to solve and address. They gathered on the occasion of International Drug Users' Remembrance Day.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); PfS: Pulse for Stuttgart; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 21 July 2023, at the call of The Greens, people, including councilors, members of The Greens, SPD, Pulse for Stuttgart, and The Left, as well as representatives of Christian churches, migrant, and social associations, demonstrated in Stuttgart to denounce the recent shift in the city's refugee policy, and notably the CDU party's role in this change, limiting access to new housing units for refugees. They called on the city to show solidarity and provide good housing for refugees.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); PARTEI: The Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 20 July 2023, at the call of CDU and SPD councilors, around 100 people, including the city's mayor (The Greens), as well as members The Left, unions, and Die Partei, demonstrated at Neumarkt in Duisburg against the far right and racism.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Students (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 18 July 2023, at the call of the Left, between 120 and 150 people, including members of Grannies Against the Right, GJ, Jusos, and Parents for Future (FFF), demonstrated at the entrance of the Inselhalle in Lindau (Bodensee) against a meeting of the politician Hans-Georg Maassen (CDU). Protesters accused him of being close to the ideas of the far-right AfD political party, notably in terms of migration policy, freedom of expression, and stance regarding conspiracy theories.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 17 July 2023, activists and representatives from SPD and CDU jointly protested in Beverungen against the planned construction of radioactive nuclear waste storage. Some participants cited environmental concerns.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 16 July 2023, around 100 activists marched through Kusel in protest against racism, hate speech, and fascism. SPD representatives, including an MP and district chairwoman, supported the protest.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Women (Germany)
description: On 10 July 2023, around 75 people, including Jusos members, demonstrated in front of the town hall in Greifswald to call for easier access to abortions at the Unimedizin Greifswald.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Free Saxony
description: On 10 July 2023, at the call of Free Saxony and AFD, around 1,000 people demonstrated on the Postplatz in Gorlitz to denounce a recent brawl that resulted in several injuries in a club in the city.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); Evangelical Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Iranian Group (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); LGBTQ+ (Germany); Protesters (Iran); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany); Women (Iran)
description: On 9 July 2023, around 60,000 people, including members of the LGBTQ+ community, craftspeople, an Iranian initiative, members of the Evangelical Church, Catholics, the State Minister of Culture (The Greens), and the Federal Health Minister (SPD), demonstrated in Koln for equal rights and against discrimination against the queer community. Demonstrators gathered for Christopher Street Day (CSD). The Iranian community wanted to draw attention to women's rights in Iran, notably in the wake of the death of Mahsa Amini.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 8 July 2023, between 250 (according to the police) and 450 (according to organizers) cyclists, including BUND, and The Greens members, demonstrated on the route from the Messplatz in Landau to Trifelsstation in Annweiler am Trifels against the four-lane expansion of the federal highway B10 between Pirmasens and Landau. They called for the preservation of the biosphere reserve.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; LGBTQ+ (Germany); Students (Germany)
description: On 8 July 2023, around 100 people, including members of the LGBTQ+ community, Green Youth, Jusos, and FFF members, demonstrated in Fritzlar against discrimination and for equality for queer people. They had gathered on the occasion of Christopher Street Day (CSD).

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), around 150 people, including The Left, MLPD, and FFF members, demonstrated in front of the town hall in Lubeck against the far-right political party AFD, which received 6,000 votes in the city's elections.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 28 June 2023, at the call of the Free Association of German Dentists, several hundred dentists and practice staff, with 3 members of Parliament (AFD, CDU, and The Left), protested in front of the state parliament in Magdeburg against the future lack of dentists in the region due to half of the practitioners reaching retirement age in 2030.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); LGBTQ+ (Germany); PARTEI: The Party; Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 28 June 2023, at the call of SPD, The Greens, The Left, Die Partei, Protestants, Euskirchen Peace Day, and the Queer Regulars' Table, more than 100 people, including Grannies Against the Rights, Feminists Against the Right, demonstrated in Euskirchen against the far-right political party AFD. Demonstrators gathered for tolerance and diversity and against racism and discrimination of any kind.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 26 June 2023, at the call of the AFD, around 200 people demonstrated in Grossenhain for peace.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 25 June 2023, around 70 AfD affiliates gathered in Wurzburg against the fatal knife attack by a mentally ill man on passers-by occurred on 25 June 2021. Around 1,200 people, including members of Wurzburg is Colorful, gathered for a counter-demonstration and did sit-ins against the AFD, far-right instrumentalization, and Nazis. A supporter of the AfD and a counter-demonstrator physically clashed, and 3 men were arrested. No injuries were reported.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 24 June 2023, more than 100 people, including mayors (CDU), demonstrated from the Armbrecht farm in Leiferde to Ettenbuttel for the construction of a cycle path.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 24 June 2023, around 60,000 people, including the LGBTQ+ community and an elected official (The Greens), demonstrated around Marienplatz and at the city hall in Munchen for equality, acceptance, and to denounce the increase of crimes against queer people.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 24 June 2023, at the call of The Greens, SPD, and Alliance Against the Right, around 30 people demonstrated in Putzerau in Lohmar against a summer party of the far-right party AFD. Demonstrators called for tolerance, human dignity, diversity, and were against the presence of far-right affiliates.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 23 June 2023, members of AFD gathered to stage a protest at the Marktplatz in Grafing bei Munchen to denounce inflation (gas and food prices) and to call for the end of what they perceived as coercion of citizens. People, including Antifa, The Greens, SPD, and 'Colorful instead of Brown' affiliates, gathered at the Urtelbach Bridge, for a counter-demonstration.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 23 June 2023, at the call of CDU, around 450 people, including workers, demonstrated in Nendingen against the closure of road L277 and its impact on commuting.

organizers: Students (Germany); The Left (Germany); The Left.SDS
description: On 20 June 2023, at the call of The Left.SDS, Protest LEJ, Space Leipzig, The Left, Prisma Leipzig, and Linxxnet, around 300 people gathered at Zentrum-Sud in Leipzig (Sachsen), to call for the support of asylum seekers and protest against a planned reform to the asylum laws of the EU. The protest took place on the occasion of International Refugee Day.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); Police Forces of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 13 June 2023, at the call of SPD, between 500 and 700 people, including the city's mayor (The Greens), elected officials (SPD, CSU, The Left) demonstrated in Bogenhausenen in Munchen in support of the LGBTQ+ community, diversity, tolerance, and the event of a drag queen reading books to children in a library. They were against the AFD, and racism. Protesters gathered under the motto 'Munich is colorful'. At the call of the AFD and Voice of the Silent, around 225 people, including Querdenken members, gathered for a counter-protest in front of the library as well. 7 men affiliated with the Identitarian Movement tried to enter the room during the reading and unfurl a banner. They didn't succeed because library employees prevented them from doing so, no scuffles were reported. The police later came and took the 7 men away.

organizers: The Left (Germany)
description: On 12 June 2023, at the call of The Left, around 60 people demonstrated at the market in Rosswein against the NATO military exercise Air-Defender 2023. They denounced how environmentally harmful fossil fuels are. They protested for peaceful means to resolve military conflicts. Demonstrators were against government policies, and inflation (rising heating and electricity costs, price increases in general).

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); Querdenken
description: On 10 June 2023, around 13,000 people, including AFD, Querdenken affiliates, the Bavarian Prime Minister (CSU), and workers, demonstrated in Erding against the government's planned heating law.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 10 June 2023, thousands of people, mostly the LGBTQ+ community and the Saxon State Minister of Justice and for Democracy, Europe and Equality (The Greens), gathered at the Terrassenufer in Dresden for diversity and the respect of different lifestyles. They demonstrated for Christopher Street Day (CSD).

organizers: Antifa; FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2021-); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 10 June 2023, at the call of the alliance 'Ingolstadt is colorful', numerous people, including members of FFF, Antifa, elected officials (The Greens, The Left), a protestant pastor, and the mayor (SPD), demonstrated on Carraraplatz in Ingolstadt against historical revisionism, fascism, far-right extremism, and an event of the revisionist association ZFI - Ingolstadt Research Institute for Contemporary Historical Research.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 7 June 2023, around 100 people, mostly striking employees of Karstadt-Galeria-Kaufhof and mayors (The Greens), demonstrated in Munchen against the closure of their store at Bahnhofsplatz.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Last Generation (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; REBELL: Youth League Rebel; Students (Germany)
description: On 2 June 2023, at the call of ALG, FFF, MLPD, and REBELL, around 100 people gathered in Schwabisch Hall, to protest against police raids and incarcerations against ALG activists in the days prior. They also called for more climate action.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; Government of Germany (2021-); NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union; The Left (Germany)
description: On 2 June 2023, at the call of BUND, NABU, and Landesgemeinschaft Naturschutz und Umwelt (LNU), more than 20 people, including environmental activists and a The Left councilor, gathered at Auf den Heunen in Leverkusen, to protest against the planned construction of a fire brigade station in a local ecological protection zone.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 June 2023, around 80 people, mostly teenagers and students, gathered at Johannisplatz in Leipzig, to protest for children's rights on the occasion of International Children's Day. The member of state parliament Juliane Nagel (The Left) was taken into custody by the police. Police claimed that she assaulted them beforehand, while the parliamentarian argued she was insulted and pushed before being arrested.

organizers: Last Generation (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 31 May 2023, at the call of ALG and MLPD, around 350 to 400 people gathered in Koln, to protest against police raids and incarcerations against ALG activists in the days prior. They also called for more climate action.

organizers: Alevi Muslim Group (Germany); Antifa; ATIK: Confederation of Workers from Turkey in Europe; FVC: Women Association Courage; IB: Internationalist Alliance; Kurdish Ethnic Group (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Labor Group (Turkey); Migrants (International); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Protesters (International); Protesters (Turkey); REBELL: Youth League Rebel; The Greens (Germany); Turkish Group (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 29 May 2023, at the call of IB, around 140 people, from 11 countries, including the chairwoman of the MLPD, members of The Greens, Solingen 93, the Left Forum, REBELL, AKTIV, FVC, Antifa, Circle of Friends Refugee Solidarity in Solidarity International, ECHR - European Confederation of Democratic Rights, ATIK (YDG), ATIF, BIR-KAR, Kurdish activists, migrant organizations, MLKP, Partizan, TKIP, Turkish People's Front in Europe, and Alevis, demonstrated at Walter Scheel Square in Solingen for the ban of all fascist organizations and their propaganda. They denounced the policies of the German and Turkish governments.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 28 May 2023, around 400 people, including the mayor (SPD), demonstrated in front of the Festhalle in Frankfurt am Main against the concert of a British rock musician, denouncing anti-Semitism. Demonstrators were against hatred of Israel and conspiracy theories.

organizers: AI: Amnesty International; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Iranian Group (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 27 May 2023, at the call of Welcome In! and Amnesty International, around 40 people, including members of the Iranian community and the mayor (CDU), demonstrated at the Uniplatz in Fulda against the Iranian government following the death of Mahsa Amini. They denounced violence, especially against schoolgirls victims of poison attacks. The event happened under the motto 'Woman, Life, Freedom!'.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 27 May 2023, between 100 and 250 people, including an MP (SPD) and politician (The Greens), demonstrated at Willy-Brandt-Platz in Aachen against the Iranian government following the death of Mahsa Amini. They denounced the wave of executions and called for the respect of human rights.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 26 May 2023, at the call of the Green Youth Halle and FFF, almost 100 people gathered at the Steintor in Halle (Saale) to call for solidarity with the Uprising of the Last Generation (ALG) movement following the nationwide raids against members of the climate group. They also called for more climate protection.

organizers: Armenian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany); Turkish Group (Germany)
description: On 24 May 2023, around 160 people, including the Armenian community, the mayor (The Greens), Turkish human rights groups, and the Friends of the NS Documentation Center in Cologne, demonstrated in front of the memorial on the Hohenzollern Bridge in Koln against the dismantling of the Armenian Genocide Memorial.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 22 May 2023, at the call of AFD and the citizen's alliance 'Oberkramer/Velten', around 250 people demonstrated in Velten against the accommodation of refugees in Hohenschopping and in Marwitzer Lindenstrasse. Around 120 people, including an MP (SPD), Christians, and the initiative 'WOLV - Welcome to Oberkramer, Leegebruch, Velten', gathered for a counter-demonstration.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; LGBTQ+ (Germany); PP: Pirate Party (Germany)
description: On 18 May 2023, at the call of Jusos and PP, people gathered at Lili-Elbe-Strasse in Dresden, to protest the theft of the street sign the night after its inauguration. The street was named after Lili-Elbe, one of the first people to have gender reassignment surgery - and she did it in Dresden and protesters stressed the importance of queer representation in the city.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 17 May 2023, people gathered at Richard-Wagner-Platz in Leipzig, to call for LGBTQ+ rights, on the occasion of the International Day Against Homo-, Bi-, and Transphobia (IDAHOBIT). The minister of state, Petra Kopping (SPD), attended the event and addressed the protesters.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 14 May 2023, around 60 people, led by AFD, peacefully protested in front of the Van der Valk Hotel in Gladbeck against the usage of the hotel as a refugee shelter. Around 30 people from the Alliance for Courage counter-protested to promote diversity.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 12 May 2023, around noon, at the call of the German Protestant Association for Elderly Work and Care (DEVAP), around 350 people, including striking healthcare and nursing home workers, as well as a Bundestag's national representative and Health Committee member (Greens), marched from Washingtonplatz to the main train station in Berlin - Mitte to demand better working conditions for their category, as well as better-coordinated recruitment of foreign care workers, and higher salaries to cope with cities like Berlin.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party
description: On 11 May 2023, FDP political party members peacefully protested in front of a community center in Pullach i. Isartal to oppose the visit of an anti-capitalist author.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Free Saxony; PEGIDA: Patriotic Europeans Against the Islamisation of the Occident
description: On 11 May 2023, in the afternoon, between 100 and 250 far-right activists, including members of AfD, Free Saxony and Pegida, gathered in front of the city hall in Dresden, protesting against a planned relocation of refugees to the city, while the City Council debated the locations of the planned asylum containers in the city. Between 50 and 70 left-wing demonstrators, including members of Hope - Fight Racism and Seebrucke, gathered nearby for a counter-protest, calling for higher solidarity.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 May 2023, about 50 activists, including a government official for SPD party, gathered for a rally in Schleusingen, demanding higher solidarity with refugees.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 9 May 2023, activists affiliated with AfD gathered for a rally in Senftenberg during a visit of a municipal official. They were criticizing the federal government especially over its policy toward Ukraine, supporting the Moscow's position.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Iranian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 6 May 2023, at the call of the Iranian Initiative in Saarland, around 200 people, including members of the Iranian community, as well as SPD and CDU representatives, gathered in Saarbrucken (Saarland) to protest in solidarity with the Iranian protest movement in the wake of Mahsa Amini's death, demanding that freedom of expression, women's rights, and human rights be guaranteed in the country.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 5 May 2023, around 150 people, including the mayor (SPD), demonstrated in Aalen to call for equality between people with and without disabilities. They gathered on the occasion of the European Day of Protest for the Equality of People with Disabilities.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 5 May 2023, around 100 people, including Grannies Against the Right, union members, elected officials, and the mayor (CDU), demonstrated in Konigstein im Taunus against an event of the far-right political party AFD. They gathered under the motto 'Konigstein is colorful.'

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people gathered at the Landschaftspark in Duisburg, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The president of the German parliament (Bundestag) Barbel Bas (SPD) and the minister president of state NRW Hendrik Wust (CDU) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); IGBCE: Industrial Union for Mining, Chemistry and Energy; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB and IGBCE, around 600 people gathered in Herne, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor Frank Dudda (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); IG-BAU: Industrial Union Construction, Agriculture, Environment; Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB and IG-BAU, people gathered at Ebertplatz in Oberhausen, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor Daniel Schranz (CDU) addressed the audience.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, around 500 people staged a protest march from Ufergarten to Neumarkt in Solingen, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The state minister of economy, Mona Neubaur (The Greens) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people staged a protest march to Platz vor dem Rathaus in Bad Hersfeld, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The member of (state) parliament, Tanja Hartdegen (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people gathered at Kornmarkt in Bautzen, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The member of parliament Kathrin Michel (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people, including MLPD affiliates, gathered in Cottbus (Brandenburg), to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, around 5,000 people gathered at the Romer in Frankfurt am Main, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor Mike Josef (SPD) and the head of Ver.di Frank Werneke addressed the protesters.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people gathered in Freiberg, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The prime minister of Saxony Michael Kretschmer (CDU) took part in the protests.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Evangelical Christian Group (Germany); FAU: Free Workers Union; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, SPD, The Left, The Greens, Evangelical group Kirchlicher Dienst in der Arbeitswelt, and FAU, around 200 people gathered in Hamburg - Harburg, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB and IGM, around 200 people staged a protest march through Hennigsdorf, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor Thomas Gunther (SPD) and IGM official Anne Borchelt addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people gathered in Koblenz, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, around 700 people gathered in Lehrte, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The head of SPD, Lars Klingbeil addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, around 850 people gathered in Lubeck, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor Jan Lindenau (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB and IGM, people gathered at Siegburger Markt in Siegburg, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The mayor of the city, Stefan Rosemann (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2023, at the call of DGB, people gathered in Wolfsburg, to protest for workers rights on the occasion of International Worker's Day. The federal minister of work, Hubertus Heil (SPD) addressed the protesters.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; BPD: The Grassroots Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 30 April 2023, at the call of AfD and BDP, around 300 people gathered in Ravensburg, to protest against arms deliveries by the German government and support for peace negotiations. A counterprotest called for by Grannies Against the Right gathered around 100 people.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 29 April 2023, at the call of AFD, around 400 gathered in Brandenburg an der Havel, to protest against the planned uptake of 2,000 refugees by the county. A counter protest called for by SPD, The Greens, The Left, and Neue Friedensbewegung, took place nearby with 60 people attending.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 29 April 2023, at the call of AFD, around 800 staged a protest march from Thuringer Staatskanzlei to Theaterplatz in Erfurt, to call for their election. At the same time, three counter rallies took place in the city. The largest one was organized by FFF, which gathered around 800 people, while another was organized by Grannies against the Right. Erfurt city councilors from the Left, SPD and Greens were also among the counter-demonstrators.

organizers: ATIK: Confederation of Workers from Turkey in Europe; FVC: Women Association Courage; Labor Group (Germany); Labor Group (Turkey); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; Protesters (Turkey); Women (Germany)
description: On 26 April 2023, around 70 people, including employees, MLPD, ATIK, BIR-KAR, FVC, and YDG - New Democratic Youth affiliates, demonstrated in front of the building of Gate Gourmet in Frankfurt am Main against the dismissal of an employee following strikes due to withheld wages for six months. Demonstrators were against the criminalization of workers and highlighted the important role of women workers in the struggles.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 23 April 2023, at the call of Jusos, The Greens (Germany), and The Left (Germany), around 30 people gathered in Juterbog, to protest against a party conference by AFD taking place in the city that weekend.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 22 April 2023, at the call of AFD, around 100 people gathered at Platz der Alten Synagoge in Freiburg im Breisgau, to protest in solidarity with an incarcerated potential dissident in Russia. A counter protest took place at Freiburger Stadttheater, where around 1,200 people protested against the claims by AFD.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 22 April 2023, at the call of FFF, around 1,000 people staged a bicycle protest rally from the ministry of economy and traffic to Sudschnellweg in Hannover, to protest against a planned expansion of a local highway, citing environmental concerns. A member of the local council affiliated with The Greens joined the protest. The protest was part of a national protest day, demanding change in mobility policy.

organizers: MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 22 April 2023, at the call of MLPD, people gathered at the Marktplatz in Bremen, to protest against the global capitalist system.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 18 April 2023, 8 members of AFD, including an elected official, demonstrated in the Golm district in Potsdam with a banner against immigration and refugee shelters. Around 30 people, including Jusos, The Greens, JL, Left Youth Solid, and the general student committee of the University of Potsdam gathered for a counter-demonstration.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 15 April 2023, more than 300 people, including local politicians, a city councilor (The Greens), and the mayor (independent), demonstrated in the Holzhausen district in Kyritz against the establishment of a construction waste landfill in a gravel pit.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany)
description: On 15 April 2023, at the call of 'We for Rugen', around 250 people, including the mayor (independent) and an MP (AFD), protested at Rugenplatz in Sassnitz against the planned liquefied natural gas (LNG) terminal. They denounced the project as harmful to the environment and the economy.

organizers: The Left (Germany)
description: On 15 April 2023, at the call of The Left, Solidarity Street, and the Ragazza association, around 350 people marched from Hansaplatz to Jungfernstieg in Hamburg against the eviction of homeless and mendicants. They also denounced police violence.

organizers: Antifa; Labor Group (Germany); The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 15 April 2023, between 55 (according to the police) and 200 (according to organizers) people, including members of Antifa, Round Table for Tolerance and Democracy, Ver.di, and The Left, demonstrated, blocked the exit around Grossflecken, and disrupted an AfD local election rally on Friedrichstrasse in Neumunster. They protested against the far-right political party, sexism, Nazis, racism, and neoliberalism. Minor pushing and shoving happened between police officers and demonstrators but the protest remained peaceful.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany
description: On 15 April 2023, around 200 AfD affiliates demonstrated in Nurnberg for a peace demonstration. Between 250 and 300 people gathered for a counter-protest against the political party, far-right propaganda, and to denounce what they perceive as instrumentalizing peace policy.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany)
description: On 14 April 2023, parents, a CDU MP, and students of the elementary school St. Josef protested, from Hohestieg to Goslarsche Strasse and back, in Braunschweig against the closure of the Brunswick school.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany)
description: On 14 April 2023, around 50 people, an MP (AFD), students, and parents, demonstrated in Wolgast against the closure of the Janusz Korczak school for children with disabilities.

organizers: The Left (Germany)
description: On 13 April 2023, people, members of The Left, Right to the City of Cologne, and SSM - Socialist Social Assistance, demonstrated in the district Mulheim in Koln against the eviction of a person with disabilities. Demonstrators were against luxury renovations and evictions. They called for justice.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 12 April 2023, at the call of Ver.di, around 30 people, mostly employees of Galeria Kaufhof and the city's mayor (SPD), gathered in front of the store in Siegburg to increase the pressure in the stuck collective bargaining negotiations. They protested against the decision to downsize the branch and the closure of several stores.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 12 April 2023, at the call of Ver.di, around 130 people, mostly striking employees of Galeria Kaufhof, Protestants, Catholics, and a city councilor (The Left), demonstrated in Schutzenstrasse in Munchen against the closure of the branch at the main train station.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 11 April 2023, 714 people, some of which included CSU members and elected officials, staged a protest march in Schongau, to protest against the planned closure of a nearby hospital.

organizers: MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany
description: On 10 April 2023, people, some of which MLPD members, gathered in Lubeck, to protest for peace and call for negotiations between Russia and Ukraine. The protest was part of a series of traditional protests during the easter holiday.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
